attributes.action: ensure that research is carried out into effective treatments for Complex Regional Pain Syndrome
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Complex Regional Pain Syndrome is a poorly understood disorder that is characterized by chronic, severe pain and progressive changes in skin, muscle, and bone.

There are two types of Complex Regional Pain Syndrome:
C.R.P.S. Type I (previously known as Reflex Sympathetic Dystrophy - R.S.D.)
C.R.P.S. Type II (previously known as Causalgia) 

A diagnosis of C.R.P.S. Type II is given when nerve injury is identifiable. In cases where no nerve damage can be found, but the symptoms are those of C.R.P.S., a diagnosis of Type I is given. Often nerve damage is assumed, even when it cannot be identified.


As of yet there is no cure for C.R.P.S. and the treatments available to C.R.P.S. patients are usually ineffective.
